RESPONSE TEXT: What the hell are you doing up here?
What's a man got to do to be alone?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What do you mean by "chrome-dome synths"?
RESPONSE TEXT: You know, them early model synths. Looks like metal wrapped over mechanical innards. You see them here and there doing who-knows-what for the Institute.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I appreciate all you've done.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: RickyDalton: That's better. My heart almost burst outta my chest.
RESPONSE TEXT: Who the hell is he? HQ said they were sending one agent. Not two.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Deacon: Sorry. I'm new. He's just showing me the ropes.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: RickyDalton: That's better. My heart almost burst outta my chest.
RESPONSE TEXT: Who the hell is she? HQ said they were sending one agent. Not two.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Deacon: Sorry. I'm new. He's just showing me the ropes.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Have you seen anything else? The tiniest detail could save our lives.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, chrome-domes have been going in and out for days. They keep taking things out. Crates and the like.
I got no idea what's in the crates, but there sure are a lot of them. I can't think of nothing else.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're entering Slocum's through an escape tunnel. Know anything useful?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We're entering Slocum's through an escape tunnel. Know anything useful?
RESPONSE TEXT: Escape tunnel? I don't know a goddamn thing about that. Listen if you headquarter's fellows want more help you got to give me more information.
The only activity I saw was at Slocum's Joes. But I wasn't watching every damned nook and cranny out there.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're entering Slocum's through an escape tunnel. Know anything useful?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The Railroad values your service. But we could really use more help from you.
RESPONSE TEXT: I feel for the synths and what they go through. But I have done more than my fair share. My patience is about worn thin with you Railroad types. What do you want?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Against his better judgment, think he's already a martyr

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The Railroad values your service. But we could really use more help from you.
RESPONSE TEXT: You son of a bitch. After all I've risked you want more. Screw you, I'm leaving now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm out of here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Soon I will be, too.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You've done enough for us. Goodbye.
RESPONSE TEXT: Damned straight.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ah, hell. I suppose I could spare a few things. I don't want your deaths on my conscience.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You scavenge anything that can help us? We're risking out lives out there.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's always just one more goddamn thing. Until I'm six feet under or bleeding out in some god forsaken ditch. Screw you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We're assaulting the base. Once we strike, use your rifle to pick off anyone you can see. A lot of lives are depending on us.
RESPONSE TEXT: You silver-tongued son of a bitch. All right, I'll take a couple shots. But if I see any of them coming for me, I'm running for the hills. We're done.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.
SCRIPT NOTES: Angry at himself for being persuaded, but he'll help

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We're assaulting the base. Once we strike, use your rifle to pick off anyone you can see. A lot of lives are depending on us.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's always just one more goddamn thing. Until I'm six feet under or bleeding out in some god forsaken ditch. Screw you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ricky, you ready to be a hero? Someone they'll sing songs about? We're storming that base. And we need a distraction. A big one.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's that important? If I do this, that song better be goddamn beautiful, you hear me? I saw them place the mines.
SCRIPT NOTES: Moved by the player's words, then grudging heroism / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: After you get to your tunnels, I got explosives I might be able to use to take out the chrome-domes.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.
SCRIPT NOTES: Considering, grim (he's pretty sure this will get himself killed) / Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ricky, you ready to be a hero? Someone they'll sing songs about? We're storming that base. And we need a distraction. A big one.
RESPONSE TEXT: You must think I'm a real dumb-ass to get myself killed for some song. Screw you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm not asking for you to commit suicide, Ricky.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, thank the Wall. Listen, I'll take some pot shots with my rifle. It might even the odds once things go south.
SCRIPT NOTES: Bone-deep relief, eager as hell to do something less risky / Grateful

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, if I make it out alive - you goddamn owe me. If not, never let them forget good old Ricky Dalton.
SCRIPT NOTES: Solemn, these are probably his last words and he knows it / Somber

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What're you planning on doing?
RESPONSE TEXT: I should be able to pick a path though the minefield. I can toss the explosives at the synths inside Slocum's.
Assuming I live through that, the survivors will probably swarm me. But maybe, just maybe, I'll live through it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.
SCRIPT NOTES: Very uncertain, very nervous (almost talking himself out of it as he says it aloud)

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's more of a distraction than I was thinking of.
RESPONSE TEXT: So do you want me to do it or not, numbskull?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Your sacrifice will never be forgotten, Ricky.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's all right we're here now. You're safe.

RESPONSE TEXT: Go ahead, take your time. Not like I got better things to do.
Are you done wasting my goddamn time?
You should get the hell out of here. And don't look back.
To hell with you.
*sigh* Glad that's over with.
I was prepared, Wall is my witness, to storm them chrome domes myself. But you did instead.
Once you get in your tunnel, I'll take as many of the chrome domes out as I can. I can't believe I'm doing this.
SCRIPT NOTES: Disbelief, needs a drink (about to kill himself for the cause)

RESPONSE TEXT: I should be able to bullseye a couple of them chrome domes for you. No promises, though.
Once your friend gets here, how about we have a chat, huh?
Leave me the hell alone, stranger.
Tarnation! Damn raiders are worse than skeeters this time of year.
